title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:16 <lucaa> has quit  
00:38 <abusenius> has quit  
00:39 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
00:51 <abusenius> has quit  
00:52 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
01:11 <rrodriguez> has quit  
01:30 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
01:40 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:58 <DrLou> has quit  
02:24 <Enygma`> has quit  
04:30 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
04:56 <abusenius> has quit  
05:33 <DrLou> has quit  
05:51 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <venkatna> has quit  
05:52 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:13 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <vmassol> has quit  
08:36 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <sburjan``> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <sburjan``> has left #xwiki  
08:56 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:16 <jstoldt> good morning (BTW) ;)  
09:25 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <+sburjan> hello vmassol  
09:50 <vmassol> hi sburjan  
09:50 <+sburjan> Are we gonna be able to keep the release date for 17th (monday) ?  
09:51 <+sburjan> I'd like to know in order to know if I should start testing or continue working on the Manual Test Plan  
09:55 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <+sburjan> and also, isn't 2.7M1 already released ?  
09:56 <+sburjan> or am I missing something  
09:57 <jstoldt> i think 2.7M1 was scrapped and you went directly to the one and only RC1 and by now 2.7 final is out  
10:02 <vmassol> sburjan: yes 17th is maintained for the moment but we need to find a release manager and start the release today. Also tests need to be reviewed and fixed since I believe several are still failing  
10:02 <vmassol> regarding the test plan and testing, they're the exact same!  
10:02 <vmassol> what I told silvia I thought you should do is:  
10:02 <vmassol> - test the software as you normally do  
10:02 <vmassol> - whenever you finish a test you add it to your spreadhseet table with the result  
10:03 <vmassol> that'll give you the plan  
10:03 <vmassol> then  
10:03 <vmassol> - improve it for next time  
10:03 <+sburjan> okay. This is what I'll do  
10:03 <+sburjan> I still have to go through some docs from old version in order to update them  
10:03 <+sburjan> and after, I can start the testing + filling in the observations  
10:04 <+sburjan> you can check on Draft  
10:04 <+sburjan> the Plans that have "(Reviewed)" are the updated version  
10:05 <+sburjan> another issue is that there are many documents, so It won't be easy to instantiate a new set on each release  
10:05 <+sburjan> we could either do a merge into a single large doc, or only keep one, which will be the latest  
10:05 <+sburjan> this is for you to decide  
10:06 <+sburjan> or Silvia  
10:08 <vmassol> A single spreadsheet is best IMO. google docs spreadhseet sounds good to me, linked or attached to a xwiki page later on  
10:08 <+sburjan> so you want to export to google docs what I am doing on Drafts ?  
10:09 <vmassol> export, copy, whatever you want  
10:09 <vmassol> but this is tabular data  
10:09 <vmassol> not word type documents  
10:09 <vmassol> so a spreadhseet is the easiest to instantiate it and fill the results IMO  
10:09 <vmassol> if you want to do it in a xwiki doc I'm fine too  
10:09 <vmassol> whatever is the simplest for you  
10:10 <+sburjan> ok, I will ask Silvia what to do  
10:10 <+sburjan> after I finish with these .. maybe you could review them a little bit.. not each line, but as a structure and how the table is organised  
10:10 <vmassol> yep  
10:10 <vmassol> actually gregory/silvia should review them too  
10:11 <vmassol> since they're the owner of this  
10:11 <vmassol> remember that this QA is supposed to be done outside of the dev team  
10:11 <vmassol> in order to be independent and provide a separate view of the quality  
10:11 <+sburjan> ok. I'll talk with Silvia and G then  
10:11 <vmassol> I'll also review  
10:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <Denis> has quit  
11:19 <mflorea> has quit  
11:31 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <evalica> has quit  
11:37 <vmassol> stopping  a stuck hudson build  
11:38 <\_\_mel\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <\_\_mel\_\_> Hi. after upgrading the templates from 2.5 to 2.7 the webhome page changed from "Recent Changes" to "Activity Stream". But there are no entrys in it.  
11:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <+jvelociter> evalica: Hi  
11:51 <+jvelociter> we don't have styles for disabled input buttons yet, correct ?  
11:51 <+evalica> disabled ... nope  
11:52 <+evalica> if we have something disabled we just don't show it  
11:52 <+evalica> just like action menus - if you don't have Copy or Delete right - it doesn't appear in the menu  
11:57 <\_\_mel\_\_> on the playground the activity stream doesn't work either  
12:02 <\_\_mel\_\_> the jira.xwiki.org hangs all the time.  
12:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <+jvelociter> evalica: I see  
12:08 <+jvelociter> but my use case is dynamic, in JS. According to user inputs etc. a button may or may not be disabled  
12:08 <+jvelociter> I don't want to hide it completely if it is disabled  
12:08 <+jvelociter> what do you suggest I implement as disabled styles ?  
12:08 <+jvelociter> lighter color ?  
12:18 <\_\_mel\_\_> has quit  
12:42 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <+jvelociter> cjdelisle: hello  
12:44 <+jvelociter>    
12:45 <jstoldt> is anyone around who could give me a hand with trying to make XWiki on Jetty work with MS SQL Server 2008?  
12:45 <+jvelociter> I think I've spotted a regression on the configurable class thing and registration config on trunk  
12:45 <+jvelociter> if you go to registration config as Admin, you get this message :  
12:45 <+jvelociter> This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by Admin who doesn't have permission to edit this page.  
12:45 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: Yep, seen it already  
12:46 <+jvelociter> it seems to reproduce with all custom configs  
12:46 <+jvelociter> could it be the dropPermissions call that has been moved recently ?  
12:46 <@sdumitriu> My guess is that it's caused by Velocity 1.7 again  
12:46 <+jvelociter> ok  
12:46 <+jvelociter> it breaks lot of stuff it seems :)  
12:48 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
12:48 <@sdumitriu> One thing which will never work again is #setVariableFromRequest  
12:48 <@sdumitriu> It's a perfect example of what doesn't work anymore  
12:51 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: did we ever use that ?  
12:51 <@sdumitriu> I didn't see it before, but it is intensively used in {{activity}}  
12:51 <@sdumitriu> That's why all the activities are empty  
12:51 <@sdumitriu> (on trunk)  
12:52 <@sdumitriu> I'm working on that  
12:53 <+jvelociter> ok  
13:07 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. Question for you about velocity 1.7  
13:07 <@sdumitriu> Seen the mail  
13:07 <vmassol> I'm trtying to understand why if you modify a variable passed in param the value isn't visible outside  
13:07 <vmassol> isn't this controlled by velocimacro.context.localscope ?  
13:08 <vmassol> this config param is set to false by default so I shouldn't see this behavior  
13:08 <vmassol> btw this is why the AS is fgailing  
13:08 <vmassol> failing  
13:08 <vmassol> Anca and I are on it  
13:08 <vmassol> but we don't understand the new veliocity behavior  
13:10 <@sdumitriu> No  
13:10 <@sdumitriu> I'm on the AS as well  
13:11 <@sdumitriu> Let me find the document  
13:11 <vmassol> actually we're on the warning in the console  
13:11 <vmassol> caused by Main.Activity  
13:11 <vmassol> but that's not hte pb  
13:12 <vmassol> the pb is the passing of param to macros and their local modification inside the macro  
13:12 <vmassol> so for ex setVariableFromRequest doesn't work anymore  
13:13 <@sdumitriu> http://wiki.apache.org/velocity/MacroEvaluationStrategy  
13:13 <@sdumitriu> The way macros worked before was closer to C macros  
13:14 <@sdumitriu> Now it's much closer to Java method calls  
13:14 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
13:14 <@sdumitriu> Yes it is  
13:14 <vmassol> the issue is that we've lots of stuff broken  
13:14 <vmassol> and same for users I guess  
13:14 <vmassol> let me read that page  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> Would you expect in Java obj.doSomething(x) to change the value of x?  
13:15 <vmassol> can this behavior be controlled?  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> No  
13:15 <vmassol> again it's not the issue  
13:15 <vmassol> the issue is backward compat  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> Why not?  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but Velocity is the one that's not backwards compatible  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> I told them the issue  
13:16 <vmassol> yes I remember  
13:16 <vmassol> that's wat was preventing us from u^grading to 1.6.1 or 1.6.2 as I recall  
13:16 <+lucaa> but I don't understand, we have so much code that's written like that, by passing variable to assign as macro param  
13:16 <@sdumitriu> And they decided to revert it for 1.6, but decided to do it in 1.7  
13:16 <+lucaa> we're gonna refactor all that?  
13:16 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
13:16 <+lucaa> and what's the strategy? do we have return values now?  
13:16 <vmassol> well we need to a path for users  
13:16 <@sdumitriu> I'm working on a new version of setParamFromReq which works like this:  
13:16 <+lucaa> eta then  
13:17 <vmassol> we need to start the release asap  
13:17 <vmassol> might be good to revert  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> #readParameterFromRequest($outputVariableName $parameterName $defaultValue)  
13:17 <vmassol> I don't like that we change ttihng  
13:17 <vmassol> and break them  
13:17 <vmassol> without any plan for fixing them  
13:17 <vmassol> which is what happezned  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> Internally it does an #eval so that it creates a variable whose name you pass in the first paramete  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> r  
13:17 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: So we switch back to 1.6 indefinitely?  
13:18 <vmassol> I didn't say that  
13:18 <vmassol> we need to  
13:18 <@sdumitriu> And decide that Velocity doesn't fit our needs anymore?  
13:18 <vmassol> 1) identify incompat issues  
13:18 <vmassol> 2) find a migration plan to fix them  
13:18 <vmassol> 3) and to announce it to users to tell them what they need to do and how they upgrade  
13:18 <vmassol> seems like we're doing it cwboy style now  
13:18 <vmassol> cwboy  
13:18 <vmassol> cowboy  
13:18 <@sdumitriu> I don't think the problem is as severe as it seems  
13:19 <@sdumitriu> It only affects a certain kind of macro usage  
13:19 <vmassol> is that the only backward compat issue?  
13:19 <vmassol> any other?  
13:19 <@sdumitriu> The Velocity guys were very surprised it even worked that way when I pointed to them that it was a regression  
13:19 <@sdumitriu> As far as I see, it's the only one  
13:19 <@sdumitriu> There will be more in 2.0  
13:20 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <@sdumitriu> They will remove $velocityCount in favor of $foreach.count  
13:20 <vmassol> have you verified all places where we use this kind of set in macros?  
13:20 <@sdumitriu> Continuing, this kind of macro usage was "recently" introduced in our own code, starting with the 2.0 blog application  
13:20 <vmassol> or are we going to discover them one by one?  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> Not yet  
13:21 <+lucaa> no  
13:21 <+lucaa> that's not true, sergiu  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> I will check them one by one  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> I don't think our users have many such macros  
13:21 <@sdumitriu> And for SAS customers, we'll handle most migrations anyway  
13:22 <@sdumitriu> Sure, it breaks stuff, and I wish there was a way around it  
13:23 <jstoldt> have a nice weekend folks  
13:23 <@sdumitriu> But that's a core Java change which is unlikely to be reintroduced with a config param  
13:23 <@sdumitriu> We could talk with the velocity devs to see if there's any solution  
13:23 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the very least is to document it  
13:23 <jstoldt> bye  
13:23 <jstoldt> has quit  
13:23 <vmassol> or point to a velocity upgrade guide  
13:23 <@sdumitriu> I guess a faster solution would be to deploy our own patched version of Velocity  
13:23 <@sdumitriu> Yes, definitely  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> I'll make this a big red error in the release notes  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> I'll even use <blink>  
13:24 <@sdumitriu> :p  
13:24 <vmassol> I still don't understand why they did it in 1.7 when 2.0 is around the corner  
13:24 <+lucaa> +1 for the blink!  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, 1.7 or 2.0, this would have happened eventually  
13:25 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: ETA for the setVariableFromRequest, please  
13:25 <+lucaa> we need it  
13:26 <vmassol> ASAP  
13:26 <+lucaa> I mean do you have it, do you commit it  
13:26 <+lucaa> ?  
13:26 <+lucaa> do we fix it  
13:26 <+lucaa> ?  
13:26 <@sdumitriu> setVariableFromRequest is unfixable  
13:26 <@sdumitriu> I added an @deprecated warning on it  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> And I'm writing readVariableFromRequest  
13:27 <@sdumitriu> Halfway there, fell asleep around 7:15  
13:27 <+lucaa> :)  
13:27 <vmassol> come on!  
13:27 <+lucaa> 7:15  
13:27 <vmassol> I thought you were stronger than that  
13:27 <+lucaa> most of us were up at that time!  
13:27 <+lucaa> :)  
13:28 <+lucaa> ETA?  
13:28 <@sdumitriu> Give me 20  
13:28 <+lucaa> wait  
13:28 <+lucaa> wait  
13:28 <+lucaa> that makes it 4 fixes?  
13:28 <+lucaa> fives  
13:29 <+lucaa> ok, then we rely on you for this, right? there are lots of tests failing because of that thing impacting the activity  
13:29 <+lucaa> activity macro that os  
13:29 <+lucaa> is  
13:30 <@sdumitriu> I'm wondering about a thing  
13:31 <@sdumitriu> If the parameter is present in the URL, but has an empty value, the default is used  
13:31 <@sdumitriu> Isn't the fact that the parameter is there important?  
13:31 <+sburjan> @all question : I an viewing an older version of a document. BUt when I try to edit with wiki and wysywig I get the actual version. (latest). is this normal ?  
13:31 <+lucaa> sburjan: you cannot edit an older version  
13:31 <+sburjan> ok  
13:31 <+lucaa> it doesn't make sense  
13:32 <+lucaa> (in my head)  
13:32 <+lucaa> maybe we should make it more obvious that it  
13:32 <+lucaa> it's editing the current version, but editing a history entry doesn't make sense  
13:32 <+sburjan> it makes sense if you want to get some code that was in a prev version, but not in the last one :P  
13:33 <+lucaa> you can use viewer=code  
13:33 <+lucaa> for that specific revision  
13:33 <@sdumitriu> OK, I think I've nailed it, let me check it works  
13:34 <+sburjan> lucaa: doesnt work  
13:35 <+lucaa> hmm...  
13:35 <+lucaa> then I don't know... I would say viewer=code should work, rather than edit  
13:35 <+sburjan> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/Drafts/TestingSpaceIndexAndSpacesMacro?rev=1.1?viewer=code I get a stack trace  
13:36 <+lucaa> sburjan & is the separator between params in http get syntax  
13:36 <+lucaa> !  
13:36 <+lucaa> ?rev&viewer  
13:36 <+lucaa> !  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> What's the exact issue with velocity? or what should I search for to find it?  
13:37 <+sburjan> now works, thanks  
13:38 <@cjdelisle> 08:20 < vmassol> ping me again tomorrow please  
13:38 <@cjdelisle> (TransactionRunnable)  
13:39 <@cjdelisle> I'm about to make a couple of changes because of an improvement which I thought of as a result of Denis's email, you can read that on the list to see the details.  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> Works!  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> Committing  
13:40 <@cjdelisle> patched velocity?  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> No  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> Solved Activity  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> But I think I'll apply https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-681 locally  
13:41 <@cjdelisle> I see. Where can I read about the velocity issue? Any search terms which will lead me in the right direction?  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Read that issue  
13:41 <@cjdelisle> Ok, thanks.  
13:42 <@sdumitriu> And the documentation at http://wiki.apache.org/velocity/MacroEvaluationStrategy  
13:43 <vmassol> cjdelisle: thanks for the reminder…. i thought you'd forget it! ;)  
13:43 <vmassol> (kidding)  
13:43 <@cjdelisle> hehehe  
13:43 <@cjdelisle> Hmm that velocity change shouldn't break me unless I just made a mistake.  
13:44 <@cjdelisle> I agree it's the right direction, it's a hard change though.  
13:48 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> Hm, actually I might salvage #setVariableFromRequest  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> Only when the output variable is undefined  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> Since I can get its name when it's null  
14:00 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <@sdumitriu> Hehe, I'm good  
14:05 <@sdumitriu> OK, I can salvage #setVariableFromRequest completely  
14:06 <+lucaa> aaah nooo, not like that  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> lucaa, vmassol XWIKI-5890  
14:16 <@sdumitriu> Activity works now  
14:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: question for you. I'm with Anca and we need translations for macros (for the dashboard). We need a place where to extract the code used in the wysiwyg to compute the transaltion. I think the best is in localization module itself. it's temporary of course till the localization module is finished. WDYT?  
14:18 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: this is the mail http://markmail.org/thread/7esompwicl6j6itz  
14:19 <vmassol> sdumitriu: however should we remove what currently exists in the localization module since it's not used. An alternative is to move the public apis in the internal module (the 3 classes you have now: Bundle, LocalizationManager and WikiInformation)  
14:19 <vmassol> (we don't want people to start using these apis)  
14:19 <@sdumitriu> I can commit what I have so far in there  
14:20 <@sdumitriu> It's better than the current code  
14:20 <vmassol> what's the status?  
14:20 <vmassol> working?  
14:20 <vmassol> design ok?  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> I don't remember very well, but best case scenario is that it's fully functional, just missing a {{wiki macro}} to make it usable without velocity  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> I'll have to check  
14:21 <vmassol> you have tests? :)  
14:21 <vmassol> I could'nt find any in the current code  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> Not sure about tests  
14:21 <vmassol> (I wanted to verify if it was working)  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
14:21 <vmassol> if we do this then we postpone localization of dashboard to M2, which is ok IMO. However we need your commitment to commit something working asap  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> Before M1?  
14:22 <vmassol> no  
14:22 <vmassol> at beginning of m2 to have dashboard translations in m2 final  
14:22 <vmassol> (knowing that your priority is user status for M2....)  
14:22 <vmassol> will you have enough time?  
14:23 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
14:24 <@sdumitriu> {{translate}} macros are not critical to have the code in there  
14:24 <vmassol> yes you don't need it initially  
14:24 <vmassol> s/you/we/  
14:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can you reply to Anca's mail http://markmail.org/thread/7esompwicl6j6itz ?  
14:25 <vmassol> to let everyone know your plan to impleent a first version of the localization module for M2  
14:26 <venkatna> has quit  
14:26 <@sdumitriu> K  
14:30 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you give me some feedback on this ?  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ManualTestingPlanGreatMerge  
14:32 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: haha just seen your fix, nice  
14:40 <vmassol> sdumitriu: maybe you could use http://velocity.apache.org/tools/devel/javadoc/org/apache/velocity/tools/generic/ConversionTool.html instead of $util.parseBoolean/etc?  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I don't like $util that much  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> But that's another topic  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> $conversiontool isn't even enabled  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> It might be in tools-2.0 only, and we didn't upgrade yet  
14:42 <+jvelociter> tools 2.0 have been released ?  
14:42 <+jvelociter> (there is the displaytool I am interested in, in it)  
14:44 <@sdumitriu> It's hard to upgrade at the moment  
14:44 <@sdumitriu> XWIKI-5347  
14:45 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: can't we not drag struts with it ?  
14:45 <@sdumitriu> Not sure  
14:45 <+jvelociter> oh, it's packaged in the jar ?  
14:46 <vmassol> sdumitriu: have we reported to them that it should be optional?
